jobs.title: Physician AI Researcher
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us:

Ambience Healthcare is the leading AI platform for documentation, coding, and clinical workflow, built to reduce administrative burden and protect revenue integrity at the point of care. Trusted by top health systems across North America, Ambience’s platform is live across outpatient, emergency, and inpatient settings, supporting more than 100 specialties with real-time, coding-aware documentation. The platform integrates directly with Epic, Oracle Cerner, athenahealth, and other major EHRs. Founded in 2020 by Mike Ng and Nikhil Buduma, Ambience is headquartered in San Francisco and backed by Oak HC/FT, Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), OpenAI Startup Fund, Kleiner Perkins, and other leading investors.

Join us in the endeavor of accelerating the path to safe & useful clinical super intelligence by becoming part of our community of problem solvers, technologists, clinicians, and innovators.

The Role:

Join a dynamic team revolutionizing healthcare through AI-powered solutions that enhance clinician productivity and reduce administrative burdens. This role blends clinical expertise with technical problem-solving and application of advanced cutting-edge AI technologies, supporting the development of accurate and effective medical documentation, coding, and other AI tools to give clinicians superpowers.

What You'll Do:

  • Prototype and experiment with state-of-the-art models, techniques, and architectures, collaborating with clinicians and technical teams to improve user experience and functionality.

  • Design experiments, success criteria, and roadmaps for novel products and features.

  • Evaluate and refine AI models to ensure clinical accuracy and reliability.

  • Curate and audit datasets to maintain high-quality, representative training and testing material.

  • Analyze feedback and resolve issues with AI outputs, using clinical insights and analytical skills.

  • Expand knowledge across medical specialties to inform the development of AI solutions tailored to diverse clinical needs.

Who You Are:

  • Advanced clinical degree (e.g., MD, DO) with hands-on experience in medical documentation workflows.

  • Strong communication, adaptability, and problem-solving skills.

  • Commitment to continuous learning and staying current with technical advancements.

Preferred:

  • Willing to work 3 days/week from the San Francisco office


Pay Transparency
We offer a base compensation range of approximately $205,000–$300,000 per year, exclusive of equity. This intentionally broad range provides flexibility for candidates to tailor their cash and equity mix based on individual preferences. Our compensation philosophy prioritizes meaningful equity grants, enabling team members to share directly in the impact they help create. If your expectations fall outside of this range, we still encourage you to apply—our approach to compensation considers a range of factors to ensure alignment with each candidate's unique needs and preferences.

Being at Ambience: 

  • An opportunity to work with cutting edge AI technology, on a product that dramatically improves the quality of life for healthcare providers and the quality of care they can provide to their patients

  • Dedicated budget for personal development, including access to world class mentors, advisors, and an in-house executive coach

  • Work alongside a world-class, diverse team that is deeply mission aligned

  • Ownership over your success and the ability to significantly impact the growth of our company

  • Competitive salary and equity compensation with benefits including health, dental, and vision coverage, quarterly retreats, unlimited PTO, and a 401(k) plan

Ambience is committed to supporting every candidate’s ability to fully participate in our hiring process. If you need any accommodations during your application or interviews, please reach out to our Recruiting team at accommodations@ambiencehealth.com. We’ll handle your request confidentially and work with you to ensure an accessible and equitable experience for all candidates.

jobs.title: Staff Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us:

Ambience Healthcare is the leading AI platform for documentation, coding, and clinical workflow, built to reduce administrative burden and protect revenue integrity at the point of care. Trusted by top health systems across North America, Ambience’s platform is live across outpatient, emergency, and inpatient settings, supporting more than 100 specialties with real-time, coding-aware documentation. The platform integrates directly with Epic, Oracle Cerner, athenahealth, and other major EHRs. Founded in 2020 by Mike Ng and Nikhil Buduma, Ambience is headquartered in San Francisco and backed by Oak HC/FT, Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), OpenAI Startup Fund, Kleiner Perkins, and other leading investors.

Join us in the endeavor of accelerating the path to safe & useful clinical super intelligence by becoming part of our community of problem solvers, technologists, clinicians, and innovators.

About the Role

We’re looking for a Staff Product Designer to own and accelerate the end-to-end user experience across our Clinical AI products. You’ll drive key product initiatives from whiteboard to launch—partnering closely with engineering, product, clinical experts, and our customers.

What You’ll Accomplish

  • Own end-to-end product design across high-priority features, from rough sketches to polished shipped experiences

  • Deeply understand our users—especially clinicians—through embedded research, shadowing, and feedback loops

  • Drive clarity in ambiguity: partner with PMs, engineers, and clinical AI research teams to shape the roadmap and translate complex workflows into elegant, intuitive UX

  • Build scalable design systems that enable rapid prototyping without sacrificing quality or consistency

  • Mentor designers and influence culture, bringing design thinking into product strategy conversations, critiques, and postmortems

  • Act like an owner: whether it’s improving cross-functional tooling or jumping into front-end polish, you’ll do what it takes to deliver great outcomes

We’d Love to Hear From You If You…

  • Thrive in fast-paced, ambiguous environments and take initiative without waiting for direction

  • Have shipped high-impact product design work in technically complex B2B Saas domains

  • Are fluent across the full design stack—research, UX, UI, prototyping, systems—and can pivot fluidly as needed

  • Communicate clearly with technical and non-technical partners alike (engineers, clinicians, execs)

  • Obsess over the user experience, especially for high-stakes, high-friction workflows

  • Operate with speed, experimentation, and a bias toward action

Why Join Us

  • Transformative impact: Help shape the future of AI-powered healthcare, directly improving clinician and patient outcomes

  • Extreme ownership: You’ll operate with autonomy, influence product direction, and own design from strategy to pixel-perfect execution

  • Frontier AI: Work at the edge of generative AI, deeply embedded into real-world workflows

Bonus Points For

  • Experience designing for clinicians, healthcare systems, or complex enterprise users

  • Hands-on experience with front-end styling or contributing to a design system repo

  • A track record of mentoring other designers or helping shape design orgs from the ground up

Pay Transparency

The base compensation for this role is approximately $220,000 - $290,000 per year, excluding equity or bonus. We’re providing flexibility so you can strike a cash vs. equity balance that works best for you. Our philosophy is to offer meaningful equity so our team shares directly in the value we build.

Are you outside this range? We encourage you to apply — we consider individual needs and experiences.

Location

We are targeting candidates within commutable distance of our San Francisco, CA office for this role.

Being at Ambience: 

  • An opportunity to work with cutting edge AI technology, on a product that dramatically improves the quality of life for healthcare providers and the quality of care they can provide to their patients

  • Dedicated budget for personal development, including access to world class mentors, advisors, and an in-house executive coach

  • Work alongside a world-class, diverse team that is deeply mission aligned

  • Ownership over your success and the ability to significantly impact the growth of our company

  • Competitive salary and equity compensation with benefits including health, dental, and vision coverage, quarterly retreats, unlimited PTO, and a 401(k) plan

Ambience is committed to supporting every candidate’s ability to fully participate in our hiring process. If you need any accommodations during your application or interviews, please reach out to our Recruiting team at accommodations@ambiencehealth.com. We’ll handle your request confidentially and work with you to ensure an accessible and equitable experience for all candidates.

jobs.title: Staff Technical Sourcer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us:

Ambience Healthcare is the leading AI platform for documentation, coding, and clinical workflow, built to reduce administrative burden and protect revenue integrity at the point of care. Trusted by top health systems across North America, Ambience’s platform is live across outpatient, emergency, and inpatient settings, supporting more than 100 specialties with real-time, coding-aware documentation. The platform integrates directly with Epic, Oracle Cerner, athenahealth, and other major EHRs. Founded in 2020 by Mike Ng and Nikhil Buduma, Ambience is headquartered in San Francisco and backed by Oak HC/FT, Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), OpenAI Startup Fund, Kleiner Perkins, and other leading investors.

Join us in the endeavor of accelerating the path to safe & useful clinical super intelligence by becoming part of our community of problem solvers, technologists, clinicians, and innovators.

The Role:

We’re looking for a mission-driven Staff Technical Sourcer to join a foundational team in Ambience’s technical recruiting efforts. In this high-impact, zero-to-one role, you’ll partner closely with our engineering leaders to design and execute sourcing strategies that identify and engage world-class technical talent. You’ll own the top of the funnel: mapping markets, driving outreach experiments, and delivering high-signal candidates across engineering and machine learning roles. This is a builder's role for someone who thrives in ambiguity, works with urgency, and has a deep appreciation for the art and science of sourcing.

This role is Remote friendly in the Continental U.S.

What You’ll Do:

  • Own technical sourcing strategy for high-priority engineering roles, with a focus on backend and full-stack engineers, and machine learning engineers where applicable.

  • Quickly calibrate on candidate profiles with hiring managers and deliver high-signal pipelines aligned to team needs.

  • Develop scalable sourcing systems – including search strategies, talent maps, and outreach sequences – that balance creativity with repeatability.

  • Act as a sourcing SME within the recruiting org, contributing playbooks, enablement resources, and best practices.

  • Drive candidate engagement through personalized outreach and compelling storytelling that showcases Ambience’s mission and impact.

  • Champion an exceptional candidate experience, ensuring every interaction builds trust, equity, and long-term brand value.

Who You Are:

  • Experienced – 7+ years in technical sourcing or recruiting, including at least 2 years in a high-growth startup where adaptability, resourcefulness, and creativity were essential.

  • Technical depth – strong understanding of software engineering domains (backend, full-stack, platform, infrastructure, security) with the ability to identify both technical proficiency and cultural fit. Exposure to sourcing ML or AI-driven healthcare talent is a plus.

  • High-velocity operator – you ramp quickly, analyze profiles with precision, and run crisp recruiter pre-screens that deliver clarity early in the funnel.

  • Resilient and adaptive – you thrive in the unknown, bounce back from setbacks, and make progress despite limited direction or resources.

  • Persuasive communicator – equally skilled at pitching hard-to-reach candidates and aligning with execs, distilling complexity into actionable insights.

  • Outcome-oriented – you move with urgency and ownership, consistently optimizing for impact over process.

  • Mission-driven – you care deeply about improving healthcare and can compellingly pitch Ambience’s vision in competitive markets


Pay Transparency
We offer a base compensation range of approximately $165,000–$195,000 per year, exclusive of equity. This intentionally broad range provides flexibility for candidates to tailor their cash and equity mix based on individual preferences. Our compensation philosophy prioritizes meaningful equity grants, enabling team members to share directly in the impact they help create. If your expectations fall outside of this range, we still encourage you to apply—our approach to compensation considers a range of factors to ensure alignment with each candidate's unique needs and preferences.

Being at Ambience: 

  • An opportunity to work with cutting edge AI technology, on a product that dramatically improves the quality of life for healthcare providers and the quality of care they can provide to their patients

  • Dedicated budget for personal development, including access to world class mentors, advisors, and an in-house executive coach

  • Work alongside a world-class, diverse team that is deeply mission aligned

  • Ownership over your success and the ability to significantly impact the growth of our company

  • Competitive salary and equity compensation with benefits including health, dental, and vision coverage, quarterly retreats, unlimited PTO, and a 401(k) plan

Ambience is committed to supporting every candidate’s ability to fully participate in our hiring process. If you need any accommodations during your application or interviews, please reach out to our Recruiting team at accommodations@ambiencehealth.com. We’ll handle your request confidentially and work with you to ensure an accessible and equitable experience for all candidates.

jobs.title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us:

Ambience Healthcare is the leading AI platform for documentation, coding, and clinical workflow, built to reduce administrative burden and protect revenue integrity at the point of care. Trusted by top health systems across North America, Ambience’s platform is live across outpatient, emergency, and inpatient settings, supporting more than 100 specialties with real-time, coding-aware documentation. The platform integrates directly with Epic, Oracle Cerner, athenahealth, and other major EHRs. Founded in 2020 by Mike Ng and Nikhil Buduma, Ambience is headquartered in San Francisco and backed by Oak HC/FT, Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), OpenAI Startup Fund, Kleiner Perkins, and other leading investors.

Join us in the endeavor of accelerating the path to safe & useful clinical super intelligence by becoming part of our community of problem solvers, technologists, clinicians, and innovators.

The Role:

As a Senior Full-Stack Engineer, you will play a crucial role in both the development and continuous improvement of our user-facing web applications and backend systems. You will work closely with Product Managers, Designers, and other stakeholders to deliver high-quality, scalable, and secure software solutions that meet the evolving needs of our users.

Our Engineering roles are hybrid in our SF office 3x/wk.

What You'll Do:

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement new features and enhancements in our web applications, focusing on delivering an exceptional user experience.

  • Take end-to-end ownership of large software projects, including planning, coding, testing, and deployment, using modern web technologies like TypeScript, Node.js, and React.

  • Maintain and enhance our WebEMR integration capabilities, working on both frontend and backend components to ensure seamless interoperability with various healthcare systems.

  • Drive the improvement of our internal tools and dashboards, ensuring they meet the evolving needs of our team and support efficient operations.

  • Champion best practices in software development, including code reviews, testing, and maintainability, to ensure high-quality and resilient software.

  • Contribute to the design and implementation of robust API, authentication, and middleware solutions, enhancing the scalability and security of our platform.

Who You Are:

  • 5+ years of relevant experience in software development, with a proven track record of success.

  • Strong proficiency in TypeScript, Node.js, and React, with a willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies as needed.

  • A demonstrated history of delivering impactful software projects, with a strong portfolio of work that showcases your skills across the full stack.

  • A collaborative mindset, with excellent communication skills and the ability to work effectively with team members across different disciplines.

  • A proactive approach to identifying and solving problems, with a focus on continuous improvement and innovation.

  • A commitment to high-quality work, with attention to detail and a dedication to writing clean, maintainable, and testable code.

  • Willingness to commute to our San Francisco office 3x per week and travel 4x per year for team offsites and clinician shadowing sessions.

  • A passion for healthcare technology and a desire to contribute to a mission-driven organization.

Nice-to-haves

  • Experience working in high-ambiguity environments, such as startups or innovative projects within larger organizations.

  • Flexibility to work across the stack, with the ability to take on backend tasks as needed.

Pay Transparency
We offer a base compensation range of approximately $200,000–$265,000 per year, exclusive of equity. This intentionally broad range provides flexibility for candidates to tailor their cash and equity mix based on individual preferences. Our compensation philosophy prioritizes meaningful equity grants, enabling team members to share directly in the impact they help create. If your expectations fall outside of this range, we still encourage you to apply—our approach to compensation considers a range of factors to ensure alignment with each candidate's unique needs and preferences.

 

Being at Ambience: 

  • An opportunity to work with cutting edge AI technology, on a product that dramatically improves the quality of life for healthcare providers and the quality of care they can provide to their patients

  • Dedicated budget for personal development, including access to world class mentors, advisors, and an in-house executive coach

  • Work alongside a world-class, diverse team that is deeply mission aligned

  • Ownership over your success and the ability to significantly impact the growth of our company

  • Competitive salary and equity compensation with benefits including health, dental, and vision coverage, quarterly retreats, unlimited PTO, and a 401(k) plan

Ambience is committed to supporting every candidate’s ability to fully participate in our hiring process. If you need any accommodations during your application or interviews, please reach out to our Recruiting team at accommodations@ambiencehealth.com. We’ll handle your request confidentially and work with you to ensure an accessible and equitable experience for all candidates.

jobs.title: Staff Research Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us:

Ambience Healthcare is the leading AI platform for documentation, coding, and clinical workflow, built to reduce administrative burden and protect revenue integrity at the point of care. Trusted by top health systems across North America, Ambience’s platform is live across outpatient, emergency, and inpatient settings, supporting more than 100 specialties with real-time, coding-aware documentation. The platform integrates directly with Epic, Oracle Cerner, athenahealth, and other major EHRs. Founded in 2020 by Mike Ng and Nikhil Buduma, Ambience is headquartered in San Francisco and backed by Oak HC/FT, Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), OpenAI Startup Fund, Kleiner Perkins, and other leading investors.

Join us in the endeavor of accelerating the path to safe & useful clinical super intelligence by becoming part of our community of problem solvers, technologists, clinicians, and innovators.

The Role:

As a Staff Research Engineer at Ambience, you will push the boundaries of generative AI by translating cutting-edge research into working prototypes and experimental platforms. You’ll work closely with fellow researchers, engineers, and product leads to explore novel architectures, fine-tuning methods, evaluation paradigms, and data strategies—helping to define what’s possible with frontier AI models.

Our engineering roles are hybrid — working onsite at our San Francisco office three days per week.

What You’ll Do:

  • Prototype and Advance LLM Systems: Build and benchmark LLM-based systems and agents using open-source and proprietary models. Rapidly prototype new capabilities through fine-tuning, adapters, and reinforcement learning approaches.

  •  Drive Research-First Experimentation: Translate recent academic papers into reproducible experiments, focusing on fine-tuning (e.g., LoRA, QLoRA, DPO), model alignment, and hallucination mitigation techniques. Design clear experiment plans and share findings across the team.

  • Build and Evolve Evaluation Pipelines: Define evaluation methodologies using human-in-the-loop feedback, synthetic benchmarks, and task-specific metrics. Implement continuous evaluation pipelines to track regressions and breakthroughs.

  • Shape Data and Training Strategy: Curate datasets via synthetic generation, targeted scraping, and annotation pipelines. Establish practices for discovering failure cases and improving model robustness over time.

  • Contribute to a Research-Driven Culture: Write research papers, internal memos, and blog posts. Foster a culture of experimentation, documentation, and knowledge-sharing across research and engineering teams.

Who You Are:

  • Research Fluent

    • Skilled at interpreting and replicating results from cutting-edge machine learning research.

    • Experienced in designing experiments, running ablation studies, and ensuring reproducibility.

    • 4+ years of experience in machine learning research, experimental AI, or applied AI engineering.

    • Demonstrated ability to replicate, extend, or publish original research.

  • Deep Expertise in LLM Fine-Tuning

    • Hands-on experience fine-tuning large language models and optimizing prompt and embedding strategies.

    • Proficient with Python and deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch, JAX, and Hugging Face Transformers.

    • Comfortable with distributed training environments and large-scale model experimentation.

  • Evaluation and Data Obsessed

    • Deep understanding of dataset curation, filtering, and alignment with evaluation goals.

    • Familiar with human annotation pipelines, ranking models (e.g., RM, RLAIF), and interpretability techniques.

    • Experienced in building evaluation frameworks tied to real-world task performance.

  • Collaborative and Curious

    • Thrives in research-driven environments with a commitment to experimentation, documentation, and cross-functional learning.

    • Excited to prototype, present findings, and build at the frontier of AI advancement.

  • Effective Interdisciplinary Collaborator

    • Able to work alongside clinicians, product managers, and fellow engineers

    • Strong communicator who can distill complex ML concepts for diverse audiences.

  • Mission-Aligned

    • Passion for healthcare or other mission-driven industries (e.g., education, climate tech)

    • Thrives in a fast-paced, early-stage environment; takes extreme ownership of deliverables

  • Nice-to-haves

    • Open-source contributions to ML libraries, datasets, or benchmarks

    • Experience working in AI research labs, frontier model companies, or early-stage AI startups

    • Background in RLHF, alignment research, or AI safety

Compensation

$250,000 - $350,000, with the addition of significant equity.

Are you outside of the range? We encourage you to still apply; we take an individualized approach to ensure that compensation accounts for all of the life factors that matter for each candidate.

Being at Ambience: 

  • An opportunity to work with cutting edge AI technology, on a product that dramatically improves the quality of life for healthcare providers and the quality of care they can provide to their patients

  • Dedicated budget for personal development, including access to world class mentors, advisors, and an in-house executive coach

  • Work alongside a world-class, diverse team that is deeply mission aligned

  • Ownership over your success and the ability to significantly impact the growth of our company

  • Competitive salary and equity compensation with benefits including health, dental, and vision coverage, quarterly retreats, unlimited PTO, and a 401(k) plan

Ambience is committed to supporting every candidate’s ability to fully participate in our hiring process. If you need any accommodations during your application or interviews, please reach out to our Recruiting team at accommodations@ambiencehealth.com. We’ll handle your request confidentially and work with you to ensure an accessible and equitable experience for all candidates.

jobs.title: Field Marketing Manager, Events & Experiences
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us:

Ambience Healthcare is the leading AI platform for documentation, coding, and clinical workflow, built to reduce administrative burden and protect revenue integrity at the point of care. Trusted by top health systems across North America, Ambience’s platform is live across outpatient, emergency, and inpatient settings, supporting more than 100 specialties with real-time, coding-aware documentation. The platform integrates directly with Epic, Oracle Cerner, athenahealth, and other major EHRs. Founded in 2020 by Mike Ng and Nikhil Buduma, Ambience is headquartered in San Francisco and backed by Oak HC/FT, Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), OpenAI Startup Fund, Kleiner Perkins, and other leading investors.

Join us in the endeavor of accelerating the path to safe & useful clinical super intelligence by becoming part of our community of problem solvers, technologists, clinicians, and innovators.

Summary

Ambience Healthcare is seeking a Field Marketing Manager, Events & Experiences, to design and deliver standout in-person and virtual experiences that connect healthcare leaders with our vision for AI-powered transformation. You’ll leverage persona-based insights, storytelling, and market intelligence to shape programs that resonate with executives, clinicians, and operational leaders. From executive summits to industry tradeshows, conferences, and digital campaigns, you’ll blend creativity, narrative design, and operational rigor to deliver experiences that inspire engagement, create surprise-and-delight moments, and drive measurable business impact.

Responsibilities

Event Strategy & Design

  • Lead planning and execution of in-person events (executive summits, tradeshows, conferences, and partner activations) as well as digital programs.

  • Infuse events with persona-based insights, tailoring agendas, speakers, and experiences to reflect the unique priorities of healthcare executives, clinicians, and operational leaders.

  • Build experiential activations that elevate customer experience and create memorable surprise-and-delight moments.

Content & Narrative Development

  • Stay current on Ambience solutions and customer success stories to ensure content is accurate and compelling.

  • Partner with Customer Marketing and Care Transformation to identify and showcase the right customer champions at events, ensuring their stories and successes are featured in impactful ways.

  • Translate complex product capabilities into messaging that resonates with different personas — from financial decision-makers to clinical leaders.

  • Collaborate with Sales, Product, and clinical teams to develop storylines, demos, and presentations that reinforce Ambience’s value.

Sales Partnership & Audience Targeting

  • Partner with Sales to understand target accounts and pipeline goals, designing programs that influence decision-making and accelerate opportunities.

  • Develop acquisition strategies that bring the right mix of executive, clinical, and operational stakeholders to each program.

  • Ensure seamless coordination with Sales for pre-event planning, on-site participation, and post-event follow-up.

Execution & Operations

  • Manage event logistics, vendors, budgets, and timelines with precision.

  • Apply consistent planning frameworks that deliver flawless in-person and virtual experiences.

  • Identify and secure speaking opportunities for Ambience executives and customer champions at top-tier industry events.

Measurement & Continuous Improvement

  • Track engagement quality and connect event outcomes to pipeline influence.

  • Capture feedback from Sales and attendees to refine targeting, messaging, and design.

  • Continuously evolve event strategy by testing new formats, experiential concepts, and persona-based engagement approaches.

What you’ll accomplish in the first 3–6 months

  • Deliver high-impact in-person events (executive summits, tradeshows, and conferences) and digital programs that resonate with healthcare decision-makers and generate measurable outcomes.

  • Introduce persona-based frameworks that improve event content, audience mix, and engagement quality.

  • Partner with Sales to ensure programs directly support account strategies and pipeline priorities.

  • Create differentiated experiences and activations that surprise and delight attendees while reinforcing Ambience’s market leadership.

What we look for

Must-Haves

  • Proven track record managing in-person B2B events (executive summits, tradeshows, and conferences) and virtual programs.

  • Strong ability to frame narratives and translate technical solutions into persona-relevant messaging.

  • Experience collaborating with Sales to align programs with target accounts and pipeline goals.

  • Vendor and budget management expertise.

  • Data-driven mindset for assessing ROI and improving program design.

Nice-to-Haves

  • Experience marketing into health systems or healthcare enterprises.

  • Familiarity with ABM platforms and persona-targeting tools.

  • Creative flair for designing experiential activations that deliver memorable surprise-and-delight moments.

Pay Transparency

The base compensation for this role is approximately $165,000 - $190,000 per year, excluding equity. We’re providing flexibility so you can strike a cash vs. equity balance that works best for you. Our philosophy is to offer meaningful equity so our team shares directly in the value we build.

Are you outside this range? We encourage you to apply — we consider individual needs and experiences.

Being at Ambience: 

  • An opportunity to work with cutting edge AI technology, on a product that dramatically improves the quality of life for healthcare providers and the quality of care they can provide to their patients

  • Dedicated budget for personal development, including access to world class mentors, advisors, and an in-house executive coach

  • Work alongside a world-class, diverse team that is deeply mission aligned

  • Ownership over your success and the ability to significantly impact the growth of our company

  • Competitive salary and equity compensation with benefits including health, dental, and vision coverage, quarterly retreats, unlimited PTO, and a 401(k) plan

Ambience is committed to supporting every candidate’s ability to fully participate in our hiring process. If you need any accommodations during your application or interviews, please reach out to our Recruiting team at accommodations@ambiencehealth.com. We’ll handle your request confidentially and work with you to ensure an accessible and equitable experience for all candidates.

jobs.title: Staff AI Engineer (Clinical LLMs & Speech)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us:

Ambience Healthcare is the leading AI platform for documentation, coding, and clinical workflow, built to reduce administrative burden and protect revenue integrity at the point of care. Trusted by top health systems across North America, Ambience’s platform is live across outpatient, emergency, and inpatient settings, supporting more than 100 specialties with real-time, coding-aware documentation. The platform integrates directly with Epic, Oracle Cerner, athenahealth, and other major EHRs. Founded in 2020 by Mike Ng and Nikhil Buduma, Ambience is headquartered in San Francisco and backed by Oak HC/FT, Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), OpenAI Startup Fund, Kleiner Perkins, and other leading investors.

Join us in the endeavor of accelerating the path to safe & useful clinical super intelligence by becoming part of our community of problem solvers, technologists, clinicians, and innovators.

The Role:

As a Staff Machine Learning Engineer at Ambience, you will help guide the technical direction of our AI team, identifying the most impactful opportunities to build, refine, and deploy machine learning systems that enhance clinical outcomes. This role is both strategic and hands-on, requiring close collaboration with clinicians, product managers, and fellow engineers to turn cutting-edge research into production-grade solutions.

Our engineering roles are hybrid — working onsite at our San Francisco office three days per week.

What You’ll Do:

  • Define and Drive the AI Roadmap: Co-develop a 12‑month technical plan balancing quick product wins with longer‑term research bets, and lead execution on near-term priorities.

  • Build Trustworthy Evaluation Systems: Launch an automated evaluation pipeline tying offline metrics (precision, recall, latency) to live clinician feedback, surfacing quality trends in a single dashboard

  • Deliver Measurable Quality Gains: Prototype and A/B-test model improvements that significantly reduce top user-reported error classes across multiple clinical applications.

  • Level‑up our data engine: Design an active-learning loop that flags challenging clinical examples for re-labeling, reducing review time while improving downstream model performance.

  • Stay at the cutting edge: Distill insights from recent research—particularly in LLMs, NLP, and speech recognition—and drive experiments that keep Ambience at the forefront of clinical AI.

Who You Are:

  • Expert in ML and NLP Fundamentals

    • 7+ years in a production ML or research engineering role

    • Deep expertise with modern neural networks (e.g., transformers) and advanced evaluation techniques.

    • Strong fluency with recent AI literature and ability to translate research into practical applications.

  • Production-Grade Software Engineer

    • Proficient in Python and deep learning frameworks (PyTorch preferred).

    • Comfortable with modern MLOps, CI/CD workflows for ML, and containerized deployments.

  • Data-Centric AI Developer

    • Skilled at building and maintaining large, high-quality datasets.

    • Experienced in leveraging user feedback and active learning to improve model and data pipelines.

  • Effective Interdisciplinary Collaborator

    • Able to work alongside clinicians, product managers, and fellow engineers

    • Strong communicator who can simplify complex ML concepts for diverse audiences

  • Mission-Aligned

    • Passion for healthcare or other mission-driven industries (e.g., education, climate tech)

    • Thrives in a fast-paced, early-stage environment; takes extreme ownership of deliverables

  • Nice-to-haves

    • Experience as an interviewer or hiring manager for ML roles.

    • Prior work in healthcare, clinical AI, or other regulated, high-stakes industries.

    • Open-source contributions to ML libraries, evaluation suites, or benchmarking tools.

Compensation

$250,000 - $350,000, with the addition of significant equity.

Are you outside of the range? We encourage you to still apply; we take an individualized approach to ensure that compensation accounts for all of the life factors that matter for each candidate.

Being at Ambience: 

  • An opportunity to work with cutting edge AI technology, on a product that dramatically improves the quality of life for healthcare providers and the quality of care they can provide to their patients

  • Dedicated budget for personal development, including access to world class mentors, advisors, and an in-house executive coach

  • Work alongside a world-class, diverse team that is deeply mission aligned

  • Ownership over your success and the ability to significantly impact the growth of our company

  • Competitive salary and equity compensation with benefits including health, dental, and vision coverage, quarterly retreats, unlimited PTO, and a 401(k) plan

Ambience is committed to supporting every candidate’s ability to fully participate in our hiring process. If you need any accommodations during your application or interviews, please reach out to our Recruiting team at accommodations@ambiencehealth.com. We’ll handle your request confidentially and work with you to ensure an accessible and equitable experience for all candidates.

jobs.title: Field Marketing Manager, Executive Engagement & Strategic Programs
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us:

Ambience Healthcare is the leading AI platform for documentation, coding, and clinical workflow, built to reduce administrative burden and protect revenue integrity at the point of care. Trusted by top health systems across North America, Ambience’s platform is live across outpatient, emergency, and inpatient settings, supporting more than 100 specialties with real-time, coding-aware documentation. The platform integrates directly with Epic, Oracle Cerner, athenahealth, and other major EHRs. Founded in 2020 by Mike Ng and Nikhil Buduma, Ambience is headquartered in San Francisco and backed by Oak HC/FT, Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), OpenAI Startup Fund, Kleiner Perkins, and other leading investors.

Join us in the endeavor of accelerating the path to safe & useful clinical super intelligence by becoming part of our community of problem solvers, technologists, clinicians, and innovators.

Summary

Ambience Healthcare is seeking a Field Marketing Manager to design and deliver high-touch programs for senior healthcare executives. This role blends select event management with tailored executive engagement — from intimate briefings and curated leadership roundtables to account-specific activations and private dinners. You’ll work closely with Sales and our leadership team to apply account-based marketing (ABM) strategies, build authentic relationships with customers, and ensure our most strategic accounts experience highly personalized interactions that accelerate decision-making, strengthen partnerships, and expand pilot scope.

Responsibilities

Executive Engagement Strategy

  • Partner with Sales to identify priority accounts and map executive-level engagement opportunities across the buyer’s journey.

  • Apply ABM insights and tools to tailor programs by account and persona, ensuring every interaction is intentional and relevant.

  • Work closely with Ambience’s leadership team to strategize how executive participation can be used effectively to build organic relationships and deeper customer connections.

  • Design and execute programs that bring CxO stakeholders together in impactful ways — executive briefings, private dinners, innovation roadshows, and curated leadership discussions.

  • Support the development of future initiatives, such as advisory programs, that strengthen long-term alignment with healthcare leaders.

Content & Narrative Development

  • Stay current on Ambience solutions, industry trends, and customer priorities to shape content for executive audiences.

  • Translate product and clinical capabilities into tailored messaging for personas like CIOs, CFOs, CMIOs, and COOs.

  • Develop account-specific content — briefing decks, microsites, curated messaging — informed by ABM insights and customer research.

  • Help manage and nurture internal bench of discussion leaders & SMEs for customer engagement

Customer Experience & Surprise & Delight

  • Deliver memorable, tailored experiences that surprise and delight healthcare executives while reinforcing Ambience’s brand leadership.

  • Use ABM-driven personalization to design touches (custom content packages, curated gifts, or exclusive experiences) that deepen trust.

  • Ensure every touchpoint — pre-event, on-site, and follow-up — feels intentional, personal, and high-value.

Sales Partnership & Sequencing

  • Collaborate with Sales to sequence executive interactions strategically across events, briefings, and one-to-one moments.

  • Equip internal executive sponsors with account intelligence, talking points, and tailored materials to maximize impact in customer meetings.

  • Provide post-engagement reporting with ABM-backed insights to ensure learnings inform future account strategies.

Measurement & Continuous Improvement

  • Track executive engagement using CRM and ABM tools, connecting activities to deal velocity, scope expansion, and pilot conversions.

  • Capture feedback from Sales, leadership, and customers to refine programs and deepen personalization.

  • Evolve executive engagement strategy by piloting new formats and ABM-driven experiences tailored to healthcare decision-makers.

What you’ll accomplish in the first 3–6 months

  • Launch and facilitate high-value executive programs, including briefings, private dinners, and curated leadership discussions.

  • Partner with Sales to embed ABM strategies into engagement programs for top accounts.

  • Deliver personalized content and digital experiences (e.g., account-specific microsites) for priority accounts.

  • Support groundwork for future initiatives such as an advisory program that engages CxO leaders as long-term strategic partners.

  • Create surprise-and-delight experiences that leave a lasting impression on senior decision-makers and influencers.

What we look for

Must-Haves

  • Experience managing B2B executive-focused programs and integrating engagement into events

  • Strong ability to frame narratives and translate technical/clinical solutions into persona-specific messaging.

  • Deep research skills to uncover account intelligence and tailor experiences for senior decision-makers.

  • Proven collaboration with Sales to support account strategies and executive sequencing.

  • Proficiency with ABM and CRM tools to target, track, and measure executive engagement.

  • Strong communication and relationship-building skills suited to CxO audiences.

  • Creative flair for designing intimate, memorable executive experiences.

Nice-to-Haves

  • Background in marketing or selling into health systems or large healthcare enterprises.

  • Knowledge of healthcare industry dynamics, decision-making processes, and emerging technologies.

Pay Transparency

The base compensation for this role is approximately $165,000 - $190,000 per year, excluding equity. We’re providing flexibility so you can strike a cash vs. equity balance that works best for you. Our philosophy is to offer meaningful equity so our team shares directly in the value we build.

Are you outside this range? We encourage you to apply — we consider individual needs and experiences.

Being at Ambience: 

  • An opportunity to work with cutting edge AI technology, on a product that dramatically improves the quality of life for healthcare providers and the quality of care they can provide to their patients

  • Dedicated budget for personal development, including access to world class mentors, advisors, and an in-house executive coach

  • Work alongside a world-class, diverse team that is deeply mission aligned

  • Ownership over your success and the ability to significantly impact the growth of our company

  • Competitive salary and equity compensation with benefits including health, dental, and vision coverage, quarterly retreats, unlimited PTO, and a 401(k) plan

Ambience is committed to supporting every candidate’s ability to fully participate in our hiring process. If you need any accommodations during your application or interviews, please reach out to our Recruiting team at accommodations@ambiencehealth.com. We’ll handle your request confidentially and work with you to ensure an accessible and equitable experience for all candidates.

jobs.title: Staff Software Engineer, Quality Engineering
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us:

Ambience Healthcare is the leading AI platform for documentation, coding, and clinical workflow, built to reduce administrative burden and protect revenue integrity at the point of care. Trusted by top health systems across North America, Ambience’s platform is live across outpatient, emergency, and inpatient settings, supporting more than 100 specialties with real-time, coding-aware documentation. The platform integrates directly with Epic, Oracle Cerner, athenahealth, and other major EHRs. Founded in 2020 by Mike Ng and Nikhil Buduma, Ambience is headquartered in San Francisco and backed by Oak HC/FT, Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), OpenAI Startup Fund, Kleiner Perkins, and other leading investors.

Join us in the endeavor of accelerating the path to safe & useful clinical super intelligence by becoming part of our community of problem solvers, technologists, clinicians, and innovators.

The Role:

As we scale our footprint across clinical settings, quality is mission-critical. We’re looking for a seasoned Quality Engineer to own end-to-end product reliability across mobile, web, EMR, and API surfaces. You’ll introduce lightweight, high-leverage testing systems and feedback loops that allow us to ship faster with greater confidence—without compromising safety in clinical workflows.

Our engineering roles are hybrid — working onsite at our San Francisco office three days per week.

What You’ll Do:

  • Own and scale quality processes across the full Ambience product stack—mobile, desktop, browser extensions, EMR integrations, and APIs.

  • Drive test coverage by coordinating offshore QA efforts and building automation for happy-path regression suites (Appium, XCTest, Playwright, etc).

  • Integrate quality into our CI pipeline, ensuring pre-release testing takes <15 minutes and gives engineers confidence to ship.

  • Cut defect rates through clear triage processes, root-cause postmortems, and proactive bug detection tooling.

  • Instrument quality metrics across coverage, test flakiness, defect density, and resolution time—shared transparently via dashboards.

  • Prototype high-leverage improvements across tooling and process to continually raise the bar on reliability and speed.

Who You Are:

  • Technically strong: 7+ years in QA or software engineering with experience debugging across full stacks (Swift, TypeScript, Node, Postgres, cloud infra).

  • Automation-first: Experience with Appium, XCTest, Playwright, or similar testing frameworks; skilled in scripting and CI/CD pipelines (e.g., GitHub Actions).

  • Builder mindset: You thrive in ambiguity and love standing up greenfield processes. You bias toward automation and high-impact tooling.

  • Strong communicator: You write crisp test plans and defect reports that are consumable by both engineers and clinicians.

  • Proactive partner: You run bug bash sessions, support launch readiness, and rally engineers toward long-term fixes—not just short-term patches.

  • System thinker: You trace issues across codebases and workflows, looking for root causes and upstream solutions.

  • Nice to Have:

    • Prior success bootstrapping or scaling QA efforts in early-stage or high-growth tech environments

    • Familiarity with healthcare workflows or regulated domains

    • Experience using AI tools or generating tests programmatically

    • Fluency in TypeScript, Swift, or relevant mobile/web development stacks

Pay Transparency
We offer a base compensation range of approximately $185,000–$235,000 per year, exclusive of equity. This intentionally broad range provides flexibility for candidates to tailor their cash and equity mix based on individual preferences. Our compensation philosophy prioritizes meaningful equity grants, enabling team members to share directly in the impact they help create. If your expectations fall outside of this range, we still encourage you to apply—our approach to compensation considers a range of factors to ensure alignment with each candidate's unique needs and preferences.

Being at Ambience: 

  • An opportunity to work with cutting edge AI technology, on a product that dramatically improves the quality of life for healthcare providers and the quality of care they can provide to their patients

  • Dedicated budget for personal development, including access to world class mentors, advisors, and an in-house executive coach

  • Work alongside a world-class, diverse team that is deeply mission aligned

  • Ownership over your success and the ability to significantly impact the growth of our company

  • Competitive salary and equity compensation with benefits including health, dental, and vision coverage, quarterly retreats, unlimited PTO, and a 401(k) plan

Ambience is committed to supporting every candidate’s ability to fully participate in our hiring process. If you need any accommodations during your application or interviews, please reach out to our Recruiting team at accommodations@ambiencehealth.com. We’ll handle your request confidentially and work with you to ensure an accessible and equitable experience for all candidates.

jobs.title: Machine Learning Infrastructure Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us:

Ambience Healthcare is the leading AI platform for documentation, coding, and clinical workflow, built to reduce administrative burden and protect revenue integrity at the point of care. Trusted by top health systems across North America, Ambience’s platform is live across outpatient, emergency, and inpatient settings, supporting more than 100 specialties with real-time, coding-aware documentation. The platform integrates directly with Epic, Oracle Cerner, athenahealth, and other major EHRs. Founded in 2020 by Mike Ng and Nikhil Buduma, Ambience is headquartered in San Francisco and backed by Oak HC/FT, Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), OpenAI Startup Fund, Kleiner Perkins, and other leading investors.

Join us in the endeavor of accelerating the path to safe & useful clinical super intelligence by becoming part of our community of problem solvers, technologists, clinicians, and innovators.

The Role:

We’re looking for a Machine Learning Infrastructure Engineer to join our AI Platform team. This is a high-leverage role focused on building and scaling the core infrastructure that powers every AI system at Ambience. You’ll work closely with our ML, data, and product teams to develop the foundational tools, systems, and workflows that support rapid iteration, robust evaluation, and production reliability for our LLM-based products.

Our engineering roles are hybrid — working onsite at our San Francisco office three days per week.

What You’ll Do:

  • You have 5+ years of experience as a software engineer, infrastructure engineer, or ML platform engineer

  • You’ve worked directly on systems that support ML research or production workloads – whether training pipelines, evaluation systems, or deployment frameworks

  • You write high-quality code (we primarily use Python) and have strong engineering and systems design instincts

  • You’re excited to work closely with ML researchers and product engineers to unblock them with better infrastructure

  • You’re pragmatic and care deeply about making tools that are reliable, scalable, and easy to use

  • You thrive in fast-paced, collaborative environments and are eager to take ownership of ambiguous problems

Who You Are:

  • Design, build, and maintain the infrastructure powering ML model training, batch inference, and evaluation workflows

  • Improve internal tools and developer experience for ML experimentation and observability

  • Partner with ML engineers to optimize model deployment and monitoring across clinical workloads

  • Define standards for model versioning, performance tracking, and rollout processes

  • Collaborate across the engineering team to build reusable abstractions that accelerate AI product development

  • Drive performance, cost efficiency, and reliability improvements across our AI infrastructure stack


Pay Transparency
We offer a base compensation range of approximately $200,000-300,000 per year, with the addition of significant equity. This intentionally broad range provides flexibility for candidates to tailor their cash and equity mix based on individual preferences. Our compensation philosophy prioritizes meaningful equity grants, enabling team members to share directly in the impact they help create. If your expectations fall outside of this range, we still encourage you to apply—our approach to compensation considers a range of factors to ensure alignment with each candidate's unique needs and preferences.

Being at Ambience: 

  • An opportunity to work with cutting edge AI technology, on a product that dramatically improves the quality of life for healthcare providers and the quality of care they can provide to their patients

  • Dedicated budget for personal development, including access to world class mentors, advisors, and an in-house executive coach

  • Work alongside a world-class, diverse team that is deeply mission aligned

  • Ownership over your success and the ability to significantly impact the growth of our company

  • Competitive salary and equity compensation with benefits including health, dental, and vision coverage, quarterly retreats, unlimited PTO, and a 401(k) plan

Ambience is committed to supporting every candidate’s ability to fully participate in our hiring process. If you need any accommodations during your application or interviews, please reach out to our Recruiting team at accommodations@ambiencehealth.com. We’ll handle your request confidentially and work with you to ensure an accessible and equitable experience for all candidates.

jobs.title: Clinician Success Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us:

Ambience Healthcare is the leading AI platform for documentation, coding, and clinical workflow, built to reduce administrative burden and protect revenue integrity at the point of care. Trusted by top health systems across North America, Ambience’s platform is live across outpatient, emergency, and inpatient settings, supporting more than 100 specialties with real-time, coding-aware documentation. The platform integrates directly with Epic, Oracle Cerner, athenahealth, and other major EHRs. Founded in 2020 by Mike Ng and Nikhil Buduma, Ambience is headquartered in San Francisco and backed by Oak HC/FT, Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), OpenAI Startup Fund, Kleiner Perkins, and other leading investors.

Join us in the endeavor of accelerating the path to safe & useful clinical super intelligence by becoming part of our community of problem solvers, technologists, clinicians, and innovators.

Clinician Success Manager

We are looking for a Clinician Success Manager to ensure Ambience becomes clinicians' first choice across our healthcare partners. This strategic role is responsible for building relationships with influential clinical leaders, converting clinicians into passionate advocates, and driving sustained adoption through clinical champion engagement. Acting as the voice of the clinician, you'll identify workflow optimizations that deliver quantifiable outcomes while creating scalable engagement frameworks that become team-wide best practices. If you're passionate about transforming healthcare through strategic clinical relationship management and measurable impact, this role is for you.

What you’ll do:

  • Transform Clinical Champions into Movement Leaders: You'll identify and cultivate relationships with the most influential clinical stakeholders in each account. You'll convert these key stakeholders into active advocates who champion Ambience amongst their colleagues, creating a ripple effect that drives widespread adoption across the clinical population.

  • Architect Clinical Success at Scale: You'll quickly map the stakeholders at each account, establishing yourself as the trusted advisor to clinical leadership. Through strategic touchpoints, you'll transform initial skepticism into sustained enthusiasm, ensuring strong utilization amongst providers who regularly use our platform.

  • Drive Measurable Clinical ROI: You'll own the metrics that matter most to clinical success monitoring performance, implementing targeted interventions when needed and working in partnership with Care Transformation Executives to evangelize Ambience’s ROI with customers

  • Revolutionize Clinical Workflows: Acting as the voice of the clinician, you'll identify and implement meaningful workflow optimizations that deliver quantifiable efficiency gains and make clinicians' lives tangibly better. You'll systematically capture clinical insights and translate them into product improvements, directly influencing our roadmap while creating scalable engagement playbooks that become team-wide best practices.

  • Build the Future of Clinical Engagement: You won't just manage relationships—you'll design repeatable systems for clinical success. Your frameworks will become the gold standard for how we engage clinical stakeholders, ensuring every clinician who touches Ambience experiences the same exceptional journey from skeptic to advocate to evangelist.

Who you are:

  • You bring deep healthcare SaaS expertise. You have 5+ years of experience in healthcare SaaS, clinical implementation, or client success in a provider-facing role, giving you the foundation to understand and navigate complex healthcare technology environments.

  • You are a proven champion of clinician success. You have a demonstrated track record of supporting physicians and operational leaders through workflow coaching, acknowledging and addressing feedback, and driving increasing, long-term adoption and sustained success of digital health solutions.

  • You excel at driving adoption and engagement. You have extensive experience managing go-lives, supporting high-impact rollouts, and can point to measurable outcomes like utilization rates and significant gains in clinician satisfaction. You know what it takes to get clinicians not just using technology, but loving it.

  • You understand clinical workflows inside and out. You can walk through common bottlenecks in provider-facing tech, know how to spot friction points before they become problems, and have a proven history of improving workflows in direct collaboration with frontline clinicians. You're fluent in clinical terminology and can communicate seamlessly with healthcare professionals in their language.

  • You command respect across all levels of leadership. You bring strong executive presence and stakeholder management skills, comfortable building trust with clinical, operational, and executive leaders. You've successfully aligned priorities across functions and have a track record of converting skeptics into champions.

  • You are a clear communicator and exceptional partner. You translate complex user needs into actionable insights, influence internal teams effectively, and consistently share insights that shape both product direction and strategic decisions.

  • You are mission-aligned, data-driven, and impact-focused. You care deeply about improving healthcare delivery and are genuinely excited to help clinicians reclaim time and focus through AI-powered tools. You approach challenges with a problem-solving mindset, using data to identify opportunities and measure success. This isn't just a job for you, rather it's about transforming healthcare through measurable outcomes.

This role requires up to 30% travel. Travel will include onsite support during key customer events, and stakeholder meetings across the U.S. All travel expenses are covered in accordance with Ambience’s travel policy.

Pay Transparency

The base compensation for this role is approximately $90,000-$135,000 per year, excluding equity or bonus targets. We’ve intentionally allocated a wider range so that candidates have more flexibility to choose the desired cash/equity split that works for them. Philosophically, we lean towards generous equity grants so that our team truly gets to share in the impact they create.

Are you outside of the range? We encourage you to still apply: we take an individualized approach to ensure that compensation accounts for all of the life factors that matter for each candidate.

Being at Ambience: 

  • An opportunity to work with cutting edge AI technology, on a product that dramatically improves the quality of life for healthcare providers and the quality of care they can provide to their patients

  • Dedicated budget for personal development, including access to world class mentors, advisors, and an in-house executive coach

  • Work alongside a world-class, diverse team that is deeply mission aligned

  • Ownership over your success and the ability to significantly impact the growth of our company

  • Competitive salary and equity compensation with benefits including health, dental, and vision coverage, quarterly retreats, unlimited PTO, and a 401(k) plan

Ambience is committed to supporting every candidate’s ability to fully participate in our hiring process. If you need any accommodations during your application or interviews, please reach out to our Recruiting team at accommodations@ambiencehealth.com. We’ll handle your request confidentially and work with you to ensure an accessible and equitable experience for all candidates.

jobs.title: Senior Engineering Manager, Product
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us:

Ambience Healthcare is the leading AI platform for documentation, coding, and clinical workflow, built to reduce administrative burden and protect revenue integrity at the point of care. Trusted by top health systems across North America, Ambience’s platform is live across outpatient, emergency, and inpatient settings, supporting more than 100 specialties with real-time, coding-aware documentation. The platform integrates directly with Epic, Oracle Cerner, athenahealth, and other major EHRs. Founded in 2020 by Mike Ng and Nikhil Buduma, Ambience is headquartered in San Francisco and backed by Oak HC/FT, Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), OpenAI Startup Fund, Kleiner Perkins, and other leading investors.

Join us in the endeavor of accelerating the path to safe & useful clinical super intelligence by becoming part of our community of problem solvers, technologists, clinicians, and innovators.

The Role

Ambience is hiring a Senior Manager of Product Engineering to lead and scale our core engineering teams as we build the category-defining AI platform for healthcare. You’ll partner closely with product, design, and clinical teams to translate ambitious ideas into production-ready systems that are scalable, maintainable, and loved by end users.

This role is responsible for growing the team from 5 to 10+ engineers, building high-functioning pods around product domains, and delivering features that have a direct impact on clinician efficiency and patient outcomes. You’ll shape org design, culture, and process at a critical moment in Ambience’s growth, reporting directly to the Head of Engineering.

What You’ll Do

  • Build the Team: Help grow and shape a high-performing engineering group by hiring, onboarding, and developing strong ICs. Partner closely with recruiting and tap into your own network to attract and close exceptional talent.

  • Design for Speed and Autonomy: Architect the engineering team for high ownership and product velocity. Set clear team charters, rituals, and scopes of responsibility.

  • Drive Product Impact: Ship major customer-facing initiatives that expand Ambience’s enterprise footprint, while raising the bar on quality and performance.

  • Coach and Grow Managers: Mentor EMs or TLs, create pathways for career growth, and promote a culture of feedback, execution, and high agency.

  • Set Engineering Standards: Lead on architecture, code quality, release reliability, and data integrity. Establish best practices and ensure consistency across pods.

  • Partner Cross-functionally: Collaborate deeply with PM, Design, and Clinical SMEs to ensure strong planning, discovery, and delivery practices across the product lifecycle.

  • Lead Through Ambiguity: Translate high-level business goals into actionable plans, unblocking teams and delivering results in fast-moving and uncertain environments.

Who You Are

  • Experienced hiring manager; has personally hired 7+ engineers, and built teams in fast-paced, high-growth environments

  • Hands-on Leader: You bring 8+ years of software engineering experience, including 3+ years managing engineers

  • Technically Credible: You’ve built and scaled distributed systems, shipped backend and full-stack features in SaaS environments, and can go deep on technical decisions when needed.

  • Product-Oriented: You know how to collaborate with PM and Design, think in terms of user outcomes, and ensure your team is always building the right thing.

  • Execution-Focused: You take pride in delivering on ambitious goals. You know how to align a team, debug process issues, and accelerate throughput.

  • Culture Shaper: You build inclusive teams with strong feedback and trust cultures. You lead with empathy and set a high bar for engineering maturity and ownership.

  • Mission-Aligned: You’re excited by our vision to improve healthcare through AI and motivated by the opportunity to build a platform that makes a real-world impact.

Nice-to-haves:

  • Experience in enterprise SaaS or healthtech

  • Prior experience at high-growth Series B–D startups

  • A personal network of Bay Area engineers or managers

  • History of technical thought leadership (talks, blogs, open-source)


Pay Transparency

We offer a base compensation range of approximately $265,000–$325,000 per year, exclusive of equity. This intentionally broad range provides flexibility for candidates to tailor their cash and equity mix based on individual preferences. Our compensation philosophy prioritizes meaningful equity grants, enabling team members to share directly in the impact they help create. If your expectations fall outside of this range, we still encourage you to apply—our approach to compensation considers a range of factors to ensure alignment with each candidate's unique needs and preferences.

Being at Ambience: 

  • An opportunity to work with cutting edge AI technology, on a product that dramatically improves the quality of life for healthcare providers and the quality of care they can provide to their patients

  • Dedicated budget for personal development, including access to world class mentors, advisors, and an in-house executive coach

  • Work alongside a world-class, diverse team that is deeply mission aligned

  • Ownership over your success and the ability to significantly impact the growth of our company

  • Competitive salary and equity compensation with benefits including health, dental, and vision coverage, quarterly retreats, unlimited PTO, and a 401(k) plan

Ambience is committed to supporting every candidate’s ability to fully participate in our hiring process. If you need any accommodations during your application or interviews, please reach out to our Recruiting team at accommodations@ambiencehealth.com. We’ll handle your request confidentially and work with you to ensure an accessible and equitable experience for all candidates.

jobs.title: Staff Backend Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us:

Ambience Healthcare is the leading AI platform for documentation, coding, and clinical workflow, built to reduce administrative burden and protect revenue integrity at the point of care. Trusted by top health systems across North America, Ambience’s platform is live across outpatient, emergency, and inpatient settings, supporting more than 100 specialties with real-time, coding-aware documentation. The platform integrates directly with Epic, Oracle Cerner, athenahealth, and other major EHRs. Founded in 2020 by Mike Ng and Nikhil Buduma, Ambience is headquartered in San Francisco and backed by Oak HC/FT, Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), OpenAI Startup Fund, Kleiner Perkins, and other leading investors.

Join us in the endeavor of accelerating the path to safe & useful clinical super intelligence by becoming part of our community of problem solvers, technologists, clinicians, and innovators.

The Role:

As a Staff Software Engineer on the AI Platform team, you will design, build, and maintain the core infrastructure that empowers healthcare providers who use our platform every single day as they care for patients. As an OpenAI portfolio company, you will be surrounded by the leading minds in AI and exposed to the latest advancements in our field.

In the first 6 months, you’ll be responsible for setting up the foundations for long term success, investing in platform observability, reliability, and scalability. As a technical leader, you’ll be responsible for the entire lifecycle of major technical initiatives in our AI stack--from system design to deploying the code you've written.

Our Engineering roles are hybrid in our SF office 3x/wk.

What You’ll Do:

  • Design and architect major product features leveraging the latest advancements in AI to deliver a magical user experience

  • Anticipate system bottlenecks and proactively re-architect key system components before they create issues for our customers

  • Lead product initiatives with high strategic value, accelerating speed of iteration while preventing accumulation of technical debt

  • Hold the codebase to a high standard, and assist in developing engineering processes that encourage shipping high quality code 

Who You Are:

  • 5+ years of experience tackling zero-to-one engineering challenges, building and scaling systems to meet production SLAs, and navigating architectural trade-offs in distributed systems.

  • Proficient with modern infrastructure stacks, including cloud providers (AWS, GCP), containers (Docker), queuing systems (Kafka), and databases (Postgres), and flexible across the stack to deliver projects.

  • Skilled at mentoring engineers while remaining hands-on, driving quality, execution speed, and successful outcomes as a technical leader or engineering manager.

  • Demonstrated ability to own end-to-end execution, from concept to impactful results, with a focus on building breakthrough product experiences.

  • Thrives in environments of complexity and ambiguity, prioritizing collaboration and seeking the best ideas regardless of their source.

  • Values kindness, encouragement, and being a supportive teammate, fostering a mission-aligned and ambitious team culture.

Pay Transparency
We offer a base compensation range of approximately $225,000–$300,000 per year, exclusive of equity. This intentionally broad range provides flexibility for candidates to tailor their cash and equity mix based on individual preferences. Our compensation philosophy prioritizes meaningful equity grants, enabling team members to share directly in the impact they help create. If your expectations fall outside of this range, we still encourage you to apply—our approach to compensation considers a range of factors to ensure alignment with each candidate's unique needs and preferences.

Being at Ambience: 

  • An opportunity to work with cutting edge AI technology, on a product that dramatically improves the quality of life for healthcare providers and the quality of care they can provide to their patients

  • Dedicated budget for personal development, including access to world class mentors, advisors, and an in-house executive coach

  • Work alongside a world-class, diverse team that is deeply mission aligned

  • Ownership over your success and the ability to significantly impact the growth of our company

  • Competitive salary and equity compensation with benefits including health, dental, and vision coverage, quarterly retreats, unlimited PTO, and a 401(k) plan

Ambience is committed to supporting every candidate’s ability to fully participate in our hiring process. If you need any accommodations during your application or interviews, please reach out to our Recruiting team at accommodations@ambiencehealth.com. We’ll handle your request confidentially and work with you to ensure an accessible and equitable experience for all candidates.
