 - Hold the codebase to a high standard, and assist in developing engineering processes that encourage shipping high quality code 

Who You Are: 

 - You have spent 5+ years working on challenging zero-to-one software engineering problems that have spanned multiple teams

 - You’re comfortable working on a modern infrastructure stack, including common cloud providers (e.g. AWS, GCP), containers (e.g. Docker), queuing systems (e.g. SQS, Kafka), and standard database technologies (e.g. Postgres)

 - You have a demonstrated ability to own execution of ideas from inception through to successful outcomes

 - You’re willing to flex up and down the stack in order to take projects to the finish line.

 - You are a low-ego team player who prioritizes co-discovering the best ideas, even if they’re not your ideas

 - You value being a kind, encouraging, and supportive teammate to others

 - You thrive in environments with high levels of complexity, uncertainty, and ambiguity

Pay Transparency
We offer a base compensation range of approximately $200,000–$265,000 per year, exclusive of equity. This intentionally broad range provides flexibility for candidates to tailor their cash and equity mix based on individual preferences. Our compensation philosophy prioritizes meaningful equity grants, enabling team members to share directly in the impact they help create. If your expectations fall outside of this range, we still encourage you to apply—our approach to compensation considers a range of factors to ensure alignment with each candidate's unique needs and preferences.

Being at Ambience: 

 - An opportunity to work with cutting edge AI technology, on a product that dramatically improves the quality of life for healthcare providers and the quality of care they can provide to their patients

 - Dedicated budget for personal development, including access to world class mentors, advisors, and an in-house executive coach

 - Work alongside a world-class, diverse team that is deeply mission aligned

 - Ownership over your success and the ability to significantly impact the growth of our company

 - Competitive salary and equity compensation with benefits including health, dental, and vision coverage, quarterly retreats, unlimited PTO, and a 401(k) plan

Ambience is committed to supporting every candidate’s ability to fully participate in our hiring process. If you need any accommodations during your application or interviews, please reach out to our Recruiting team at accommodations@ambiencehealth.com recruiting@ambiencehealth.com. We’ll handle your request confidentially and work with you to ensure an accessible and equitable experience for all candidates.

jobs.title: Staff Full-Stack Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us:

Ambience Healthcare is the leading AI platform for documentation, coding, and clinical workflow, built to reduce administrative burden and protect revenue integrity at the point of care. Trusted by top health systems across North America, Ambience’s platform is live across outpatient, emergency, and inpatient settings, supporting more than 100 specialties with real-time, coding-aware documentation. The platform integrates directly with Epic, Oracle Cerner, athenahealth, and other major EHRs. Founded in 2020 by Mike Ng and Nikhil Buduma, Ambience is headquartered in San Francisco and backed by Oak HC/FT, Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), OpenAI Startup Fund, Kleiner Perkins, and other leading investors.

Join us in the endeavor of accelerating the path to safe & useful clinical super intelligence by becoming part of our community of problem solvers, technologists, clinicians, and innovators.

The Role:

As a Staff Full-Stack Engineer, you will be a key technical leader, driving the architecture and development of our AI-powered healthcare applications. You will work across the stack, from designing intuitive user interfaces to building scalable backend systems, ensuring seamless integration and performance. Your contributions will directly impact the efficiency and effectiveness of healthcare providers.

Our Engineering roles are hybrid in our SF office 3x/wk.

What You'll Do:

  • Lead the design and implementation of end-to-end features across our web applications and backend services.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product Managers, Designers, and Clinicians, to deliver high-quality solutions.

  • Architect and maintain scalable, secure, and reliable systems that integrate with various healthcare platforms.

  • Mentor and guide engineering team members, fostering a culture of excellence and continuous improvement.

  • Drive best practices in software development, including code reviews, testing, and documentation.

  • Stay abreast of emerging technologies and assess their applicability to our systems.

Who You Are:

  • 8+ years of experience in software development, with a strong emphasis on full-stack development.

  • Proficiency in TypeScript, Node.js, and React.

  • Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP) and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).

  • Strong understanding of database systems, both relational (e.g., PostgreSQL) and non-relational.

  • Skilled at mentoring engineers while remaining hands-on, driving quality, execution speed, and successful outcomes as a technical leader or engineering manager.

  • Demonstrated ability to own end-to-end execution, from concept to impactful results, with a focus on building breakthrough product experiences.

  • Thrives in environments of complexity and ambiguity, prioritizing collaboration and seeking the best ideas regardless of their source.

  • Values kindness, encouragement, and being a supportive teammate, fostering a mission-aligned and ambitious team culture.

Pay Transparency
We offer a base compensation range of approximately $225,000–$300,000 per year, exclusive of equity. This intentionally broad range provides flexibility for candidates to tailor their cash and equity mix based on individual preferences. Our compensation philosophy prioritizes meaningful equity grants, enabling team members to share directly in the impact they help create. If your expectations fall outside of this range, we still encourage you to apply—our approach to compensation considers a range of factors to ensure alignment with each candidate's unique needs and preferences.

jobs.title: Client Executive, Care Transformation
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us:

Ambience Healthcare is the leading AI platform for documentation, coding, and clinical workflow, built to reduce administrative burden and protect revenue integrity at the point of care. Trusted by top health systems across North America, Ambience’s platform is live across outpatient, emergency, and inpatient settings, supporting more than 100 specialties with real-time, coding-aware documentation. The platform integrates directly with Epic, Oracle Cerner, athenahealth, and other major EHRs. Founded in 2020 by Mike Ng and Nikhil Buduma, Ambience is headquartered in San Francisco and backed by Oak HC/FT, Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), OpenAI Startup Fund, Kleiner Perkins, and other leading investors.

Join us in the endeavor of accelerating the path to safe & useful clinical super intelligence by becoming part of our community of problem solvers, technologists, clinicians, and innovators.

The Role:

The mission of a Client Executive, Care Transformation is to change the experience of healthcare for patients, providers, and administrators. As a Client Executive focused on delivery, your mission will be to ensure that our clients derive significant and impactful transformational value from Ambience’s suite of products. You will be tasked with autonomously taking our most important accounts through a pilot of our solutions, and graduating them into flagship partnerships and advocates for our products and company.    

What You’ll Do:

  • Deliver impactful and lasting results for high-priority clients, solidifying their trust and investment in our solutions.

  • Build strong, collaborative relationships with stakeholders at all levels, from executives to operational teams, to maximize the value and reach of our offerings.

  • Navigate complex organizational dynamics, fostering alignment and transforming key stakeholders into advocates.

  • Showcase measurable success, converting initial engagements into compelling case studies and building a network of enthusiastic supporters for our solutions.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless client experiences, fostering long-term partnerships built on delivering exceptional value.

  • Innovate and refine best practices, contributing thought leadership to enhance how we engage and deliver for our clients.

Who You Are:

  • You have 6-10 years of experience in health tech implementation, client management, or healthcare management consulting.

  • You are an exceptional oral and written communicator with a track record of influencing executive mindsets.

  • You build strong relationships with users and key stakeholders, understanding their needs to showcase where and how Ambience can drive value.

  • You have experience managing ambiguous and complex multi-stakeholder environments in healthcare and solving difficult problems using first-principles thinking.

  • You thrive in a mission-driven, entrepreneurial environment, valuing collaboration, kindness, and effective decision-making in high-complexity situations. 

  • You have demonstrated the ability to own the execution of ideas from inception to successful outcomes, coordinating internal and external stakeholders through proactive communication.

Pay Transparency
We offer a base compensation range of approximately $150,000–$209,000 per year, exclusive of equity. This intentionally broad range provides flexibility for candidates to tailor their cash and equity mix based on individual preferences. Our compensation philosophy prioritizes meaningful equity grants, enabling team members to share directly in the impact they help create. If your expectations fall outside of this range, we still encourage you to apply—our approach to compensation considers a range of factors to ensure alignment with each candidate's unique needs and preferences. Remote.

Being at Ambience: 

  • An opportunity to work with cutting edge AI technology, on a product that dramatically improves the quality of life for healthcare providers and the quality of care they can provide to their patients

  • Dedicated budget for personal development, including access to world class mentors, advisors, and an in-house executive coach

  • Work alongside a world-class, diverse team that is deeply mission aligned

  • Ownership over your success and the ability to significantly impact the growth of our company

  • Competitive salary and equity compensation with benefits including health, dental, and vision coverage, quarterly retreats, unlimited PTO, and a 401(k) plan

Ambience is committed to supporting every candidate’s ability to fully participate in our hiring process. If you need any accommodations during your application or interviews, please reach out to our Recruiting team at accommodations@ambiencehealth.com. We’ll handle your request confidentially and work with you to ensure an accessible and equitable experience for all candidates.

jobs.title: Product Ops Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us:

Ambience Healthcare is the leading AI platform for documentation, coding, and clinical workflow, built to reduce administrative burden and protect revenue integrity at the point of care. Trusted by top health systems across North America, Ambience’s platform is live across outpatient, emergency, and inpatient settings, supporting more than 100 specialties with real-time, coding-aware documentation. The platform integrates directly with Epic, Oracle Cerner, athenahealth, and other major EHRs. Founded in 2020 by Mike Ng and Nikhil Buduma, Ambience is headquartered in San Francisco and backed by Oak HC/FT, Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), OpenAI Startup Fund, Kleiner Perkins, and other leading investors.

Join us in the endeavor of accelerating the path to safe & useful clinical super intelligence by becoming part of our community of problem solvers, technologists, clinicians, and innovators.

The Role:

We’re looking for our founding Product Operations Manager to build and scale the systems that power Ambience’s product development. You’ll be the connective tissue between Product, Engineering, Customer Success, and Go-to-Market—ensuring predictability, clarity, and transparency across our roadmap, release timing, and success metrics.

This is a highly visible, cross-functional role where you’ll define how Ambience builds, ships, and learns. From shaping our Product Development Lifecycle (PDLC) to launching our AI Lab and Customer Early Access Program, you’ll enable our teams to move faster, learn continuously, and deliver products that delight clinicians and health systems.

Our Product roles are hybrid in our SF office 3x/wk.

What You’ll Do:

  • Drive roadmap & release excellence

    Establish a predictable release operating model with Product & Engineering, ensuring roadmap clarity and visibility for all stakeholders. Lead cross-functional product education sessions and partner with Engineering on release tooling (flagging, rollback, observability).

  • Turn feedback into insights

    Build structured intake channels for clinician and customer feedback, partner with PMs to translate signals into insights, and launch Ambience’s AI Lab and Early Access Program to accelerate innovation and customer engagement.

  • Define the PDLC & enablement playbooks

    Create Ambience’s Product Development Lifecycle with clear gates (Discovery, Alpha, Beta, GA) and exit criteria. Develop enablement playbooks and materials to help Product Managers, GTM, and CS teams consistently and confidently bring features to market.

  • Measure product success

    Build BI dashboards to track adoption, usage, ROI, and clinical outcomes—ensuring success metrics are the trusted source of truth for executives and cross-functional teams.

Who You Are:

  • A systems thinker. You design scalable processes and frameworks, not one-off fixes, and bring clarity to complex, ambiguous problems.

  • A cross-functional leader. You can align Product, Engineering, GTM, and CS around a shared plan, influencing without direct authority.

  • A strong communicator. Whether presenting a roadmap update, explaining a process change, or sharing data insights, you tailor your message to any audience.

  • Analytical and data-driven. You’re fluent in building dashboards and translating raw product data into actionable insights.

  • An enablement-oriented partner. You ensure everyone—from PMs to executives—can confidently communicate and drive adoption of new releases.

  • Experienced. You bring 6+ years in Product Operations, Technical Program Management, or Product Management, with a proven record of building operational systems.

Bonus points for experience in enterprise SaaS, running early access programs or innovation labs, and working in mid-sized, high-growth B2B startups.

Pay Transparency

The base compensation for this role is approximately $180,000 – $220,000 per year, excluding equity or bonus targets. We’ve intentionally allocated a wider range so that candidates have more flexibility to choose the desired cash/equity split that works for them. Philosophically, we lean towards generous equity grants so that our team truly gets to share in the impact they create.

Are you outside of the range? We encourage you to still apply: we take an individualized approach to ensure that compensation accounts for all of the life factors that matter for each candidate.

What Success Looks Like

  • Features reach 50% adoption in under 8 weeks, with first feedback cycles starting within 48 hours of release.

  • Clinician and customer insights are systematically captured and drive product decisions.

  • Ambience’s PDLC and enablement playbooks are institutionalized and trusted across the company.

  • Dashboards and product metrics become the go-to source of truth for leadership.

Being at Ambience: 

  • An opportunity to work with cutting edge AI technology, on a product that dramatically improves the quality of life for healthcare providers and the quality of care they can provide to their patients

  • Dedicated budget for personal development, including access to world class mentors, advisors, and an in-house executive coach

  • Work alongside a world-class, diverse team that is deeply mission aligned

  • Ownership over your success and the ability to significantly impact the growth of our company

  • Competitive salary and equity compensation with benefits including health, dental, and vision coverage, quarterly retreats, unlimited PTO, and a 401(k) plan

Ambience is committed to supporting every candidate’s ability to fully participate in our hiring process. If you need any accommodations during your application or interviews, please reach out to our Recruiting team at accommodations@ambiencehealth.com. We’ll handle your request confidentially and work with you to ensure an accessible and equitable experience for all candidates.

jobs.title: Strategic Growth Executive
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us:

Ambience Healthcare is the leading AI platform for documentation, coding, and clinical workflow, built to reduce administrative burden and protect revenue integrity at the point of care. Trusted by top health systems across North America, Ambience’s platform is live across outpatient, emergency, and inpatient settings, supporting more than 100 specialties with real-time, coding-aware documentation. Join us in the endeavor of accelerating the path to safe & useful clinical super intelligence by becoming part of our community of problem solvers, technologists, clinicians, and innovators.

The Role:
As a Strategic Growth Executive, you will be at the forefront of driving Ambience's growth by developing and closing partnerships with the nation’s leading health systems and academic medical centers. Working closely with executive leadership and the founding team, you will play a pivotal role in expanding our client base and building a strong foundation of successful, referenceable engagements.

What You’ll Do:

  • Own the enterprise sales process end-to-end: prospecting, conducting discovery calls, delivering compelling product demos, navigating complex stakeholder environments, and closing contracts.

  • Build meaningful relationships with decision-makers and champions, aligning with their goals to drive buy-in and ensure deal success.

  • Communicate Ambience’s value and ROI effectively to both clinical and non-clinical executives, adapting your messaging to diverse audiences.

  • Leverage marketing resources and strategies to accelerate account progress, including tradeshows, events, and targeted campaigns.

  • Partner with founders and leadership to secure impactful, high-value partnerships.

Who You Are:

  • You have 10+ years of experience successfully selling enterprise software to CXO-level healthcare executives at large health systems.

  • You’re familiar with the provider-facing technology landscape, particularly in areas such as medical scribing, clinical workflows, or hospital operations.

  • You excel at navigating complex decision-making units, influencing stakeholders across different roles and priorities.

  • You thrive in dynamic environments, balancing high levels of complexity and ambiguity to achieve results.

  • You’re resourceful, proactive, and adept at driving significant outcomes within startup-level constraints.

  • You’re a collaborative team player with a low-ego approach, valuing the best ideas regardless of their origin.

  • You’re willing and excited to travel up to 50%-70% of the time to build relationships and close deals.

  • You contribute to a supportive and positive team culture, fostering collaboration and shared success.

jobs.descriptionPlain:
About Us:

Ambience Healthcare is the leading AI platform for documentation, coding, and clinical workflow, built to reduce administrative burden and protect revenue integrity at the point of care. Trusted by top health systems across North America, Ambience’s platform is live across outpatient, emergency, and inpatient settings, supporting more than 100 specialties with real-time, coding-aware documentation. The platform integrates directly with Epic, Oracle Cerner, athenahealth, and other major EHRs. Founded in 2020 by Mike Ng and Nikhil Buduma, Ambience is headquartered in San Francisco and backed by Oak HC/FT, Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), OpenAI Startup Fund, Kleiner Perkins, and other leading investors.

Join us in the endeavor of accelerating the path to safe & useful clinical super intelligence by becoming part of our community of problem solvers, technologists, clinicians, and innovators.

The Role:
As a Strategic Growth Executive, you will be at the forefront of driving Ambience's growth by developing and closing partnerships with the nation’s leading health systems and academic medical centers. Working closely with executive leadership and the founding team, you will play a pivotal role in expanding our client base and building a strong foundation of successful, referenceable engagements.

What You’ll Do:

 - Own the enterprise sales process end-to-end: prospecting, conducting discovery calls, delivering compelling product demos, navigating complex stakeholder environments, and closing contracts.

 - Build meaningful relationships with decision-makers and champions, aligning with their goals to drive buy-in and ensure deal success.

 - Communicate Ambience’s value and ROI effectively to both clinical and non-clinical executives, adapting your messaging to diverse audiences.

 - Leverage marketing resources and strategies to accelerate account progress, including tradeshows, events, and targeted campaigns.

 - Partner with founders and leadership to secure impactful, high-value partnerships.

Who You Are:

 - You have 10+ years of experience successfully selling enterprise software to CXO-level healthcare executives at large health systems.

 - You’re familiar with the provider-facing technology landscape, particularly in areas such as medical scribing, clinical workflows, or hospital operations.

 - You excel at navigating complex decision-making units, influencing stakeholders across different roles and priorities.

 - You thrive in dynamic environments, balancing high levels of complexity and ambiguity to achieve results.

 - You’re resourceful, proactive, and adept at driving significant outcomes within startup-level constraints.

 - You’re a collaborative team player with a low-ego approach, valuing the best ideas regardless of their origin.

 - You’re willing and excited to travel up to 50%-70% of the time to build relationships and close deals.

 - You contribute to a supportive and positive team culture, fostering collaboration and shared success.

 

Pay Transparency
We offer a base compensation range of approximately $150,000–$215,000 per year, exclusive of equity. This intentionally broad range provides flexibility for candidates to tailor their cash and equity mix based on individual preferences. Our compensation philosophy prioritizes meaningful equity grants, enabling team members to share directly in the impact they help create. If your expectations fall outside of this range, we still encourage you to apply—our approach to compensation considers a range of factors to ensure alignment with each candidate's unique needs and preferences.

Being at Ambience: 

 - An opportunity to work with cutting edge AI technology, on a product that dramatically improves the quality of life for healthcare providers and the quality of care they can provide to their patients

 - Dedicated budget for personal development, including access to world class mentors, advisors, and an in-house executive coach

 - Work alongside a world-class, diverse team that is deeply mission aligned

 - Ownership over your success and the ability to significantly impact the growth of our company

 - Competitive salary and equity compensation with benefits including health, dental, and vision coverage, quarterly retreats, unlimited PTO, and a 401(k) plan

Ambience is committed to supporting every candidate’s ability to fully participate in our hiring process. If you need any accommodations during your application or interviews, please reach out to our Recruiting team at accommodations@ambiencehealth.com recruiting@ambiencehealth.com. We’ll handle your request confidentially and work with you to ensure an accessible and equitable experience for all candidates.
